title: Baby squirrel abandoned on Cambridge patio bonds with carer
description: The squirrel, named Paquito, formed an unexpected friendship with his temporary carer.

title: Afghanistan: The 'shattered dreams' of the Ariana cabin crew
description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet meets the female crew of Afghanistan's national airline, who are in hiding.

title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance
description: Morgan Bullock from Richmond, Virginia, joins the UK touring company of the acclaimed Irish dance show.

title: Fake Paralympians boss: 'I didn't know about cheating'
description: The man fined for sending non-disabled athletes to the Sydney Paralympics breaks his silence.

title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.

title: Match of the Day analysis: How Arsenal showed ‘grit & determination’ to beat Burnley
description: Match of the Day pundits Gary Lineker, Jermaine Jenas and Martin Keown discuss how Arsenal showed "grit and determination" in their hard-fought victory over Burnley in the Premier League.

title: The link between climate change, seaweed and ice cream
description: Seaweed production has been affected by warming seas – this is how farmers are adapting.

title: Students must have say over online learning - regulator
description: The higher education regulator says students must have a say on how much of their teaching is online.

title: Sherrock makes history by reaching final before losing to Van Gerwen
description: Fallon Sherrock becomes the first woman to reach a televised PDC final, but loses to Michael van Gerwen at the Nordic Darts Masters.

title: Former pro cyclist Sorensen dies after being hit by vehicle
description: Danish former professional cyclist Chris Anker Sorensen dies at the age of 37 after being hit by a vehicle during a ride in Belgium, the International Cycling Union (UCI) says.

title: Boxer Amir Khan removed from US flight
description: The Briton was asked to leave the plane at Newark airport after a reported row over face coverings.

title: Kent put in superb fielding display to beat Somerset in T20 Blast final
description: Kent Spitfires beat Somerset to win the T20 for the second time - 14 years on from their first triumph at Edgbaston

title: Strictly champ Oti Mabuse goes for hat-trick with rugby star Ugo Monye
description: Oti Mabuse and Ugo Monye's rivals include the show's first all-male pair - John Whaite and Johannes Radebe.

title: T20 Blast final: Jordan Cox and Matt Milnes combine for magnificent relay catch
description: Kent Spitfires' Jordan Cox parries the ball to Matt Milnes for an outstanding relay catch to dismiss Somerset's Lewis Gregory during the final of the T20 Blast at Edgbaston.

title: Guardiola feels 'guilty' after Southampton stalemate
description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says he feels "guilty" after his side fail to put on "a show" in Saturday's goalless draw with Southampton.

title: Liverpool 3-0 Crystal Palace: Reds remain unbeaten as Sadio Mane scores 100th goal
description: Liverpool remain unbeaten in the Premier League this season after Sadio Mane scores his 100th goal for the club in a victory against Crystal Palace.

title: Holiday bookings surge after travel rules change
description: Travel agents report a rise in bookings after the amber list is scrapped and testing rules are eased.

title: Gas price rises prompt urgent government talks
description: There are concerns the high price of wholesale gas could have a far-reaching impact on the economy.

title: NFL: 'The kid's got skills' - Jason & Osi analyse rookie quarterback Mac Jones
description: Jason Bell and Osi Umenyiora analyse New England Patriots quarterback Mac Jones after an impressive debut against the Miami Dolphins in the NFL.

title: Aukus: France recalls envoys amid security pact row
description: The "exceptional decision" follows a pact between Australia, the US and UK, which scuppered a French deal.

title: Australia beat South Africa again to revive Rugby Championship hopes
description: Australia secure their second successive win over world champions South Africa in the Rugby Championship.

title: Covid passes: Relief and concern at Wales announcement
description: Club owners fear passes may harm Christmas trade, but those at clinical risk say they feel comforted.

title: Afghanistan: Girls excluded as Afghan secondary schools reopen
description: "Everything looks very dark," a schoolgirl tells the BBC as schools reopen for boys but not girls.

title: Red Bull in trademark dispute with English gin firm Bullards
description: The Austrian energy drink company is pursuing a legal challenge over the use of the word "bull".

title: US man sought over missing fiancée disappears too
description: Brian Laundrie, a person of interest in the disappearance of Gabby Petito, has gone missing.

title: 'Dachshund disco is a children's party for your dog'
description: Organisers James Morgan and Anushka Fernando want to help dogs socialise again after lockdown.

title: Everybody's Talking About Jamie: Sheffield welcomes home coming-of-age story
description: Jamie Campbell salutes Sheffield's role in the story of his extraordinary life.

title: Planes turned into graffiti canvasses by street artist
description: Street artist Jim Vision had an idea for what to do with planes that have ended their flying days.

title: Newcastle boss Bruce battles on after 'difficult' night
description: Newcastle boss Steve Bruce admits he faced a "difficult" night against Leeds when fans turned on him.

title: Robert Durst convicted: US millionaire found guilty of first-degree murder
description: Durst was convicted of killing his best friend Susan Berman in 2000, and is likely to die in prison.

title: The papers: Holiday bookings 'surge' and gas price rises
description: A boom in holiday bookings following a change to England's travel rules is among the stories leading the papers.

title: Climate change: Should green campaigners put more pressure on China to slash emissions?
description: UK activists have protested on the M25, but should they instead be picketing China's embassy?

title: German elections: How Angela Merkel changed her country
description: Young people have never known another leader, and many worry for the future as old certainties shift.

title: Muriel Gardiner: The heiress who saved countless lives

title: Strictly Come Dancing: 15 things we learned from the stars of 2021

title: Week in pictures: 11 - 17 September 2021
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: Lib Dem conference: Sir Ed Davey gambles on targeting Tories
description: The Lib Dems are facing a battle to get heard at their online conference but they are in good spirits.

title: Ros Atkins On… the ethics of Covid booster jabs

title: Covid calculator spots people vulnerable despite jabs
description: An online tool could help doctors identify those who would benefit from boosters or early therapy.
